Or, maybe just slope home, never mention it? Make Jeremy promise not to say jokes about it and- God I need someone to talk to, got to get my thoughts straight. Well, he's an idiot but he's my idiot.) [He rings Jeremy, but hears Jeremy's phone ringing in the bar] Jeremy?
Yeah, well he was a nice guy.
Mmm, yeah.
Sweet, what is it?
Shit! Jeremy, she's got a fucking air gun!
Thank God.
What?
(I could say we've both got enormous cocks, might be the clincher.) This is great! Isn't it?
I thought it was a joke.
(Right, doesn't sound like another Howard Marks book, but fingers crossed.) Ah, brilliant.
Right. Um... Mark, I'm glad I bumped into you, actually. About the other night at the restaurant, I just wanted you to know that I'm...
Exactly. She'll want me to take that loss adjuster's job, so I can pay for her to give birth on a trampoline made of marshmallows in a reconstruction of Greenham Common.
Not that. It's just that her tastes have changed a bit, in the bedroom.
Relax, Mark, we're relaxing. You don't want a great fat lap dancer, do you?
No. Come on mate, I'm not gonna give you any intoxicants. You made me promise.
Mark, Jeff and I aren't going to fall into each other's arms in a pile of sauerkraut. I am getting married to you, OK?
(Should have kept that line for myself, she doesn't know who Barbara is.) So, let the surgery begin. (Bloody hell, this is great! I've single-handedly re-launched the satire boom.)
Natalie's bringing up that bag of clothes you asked for.
I couldn't admit it. I was ashamed but, I did it. The bottle was full, I- I took the whole lot.
What?
Sophie told me.
Oh, it's a short cut.

I got something up on my visual display unit this morning, Mark. I thought it was a high-definition photo of some dog shit. Then I took a closer look, and I realised it was actually your sales record.
Yeah come on, dude, let's take it all the way up. Now can you take some more? Can you? Do you want it?
Yeah, so what have you been up to?
He is a weird guy.
OK, so, whoever's on kisses whoever the bottle stops at. Cool?
That's a paintbrush, Mark. I'm just talking Swiss army. Cut one up. What do you say to that?
Think you can handle a four by four?
Sophie, you- you don't need to do this. There are places you can go to! Women's refuges!
And you love me.

You know what? I'm really looking forward to the gig tonight after all. If Super Hans is into it, then I'm into it. Everything's finally coming together, and everything's finally definitely going to be OK.
You see?
Hi Super Hans, how are you doing? I just wondered whether you still wanted some drugs?
And now they've offered me the job. They've chosen me over Claire.
Me think the lady doth protest too much.
Oh, Mark, listen, I'm sorry, I'd love to but... I've got this thing.
You think so?
I think anything on the wedding day is a jilting.
Nice, yes.

You know how weak my powers of self-control are. Normally I can't wait five minutes before having a wank or a spliff or a chocolate biscuit. I've restrained myself for nearly three hours. That's got to stand for something. I'm sorry, but I'm going to tell Dobby how I feel about her.
Can we just finish the game and do this afterwards, please?
If you try to section me, Mark, you have crossed the line, and I will section you, so help me!
You know what, I'm glad. I'd rather you came clean now than start something that's not right. That actually takes balls.
She is?
He- he said he's only snogging you for a joke. And he draws horrible, vicious cartoons of you and then wraps them up in sausage meat and calls you a sausage-muncher.
I work in the music business.
Try the Diana Memorial strawberry.
Let's not kid ourselves. There's nothing going on here. We're just two planks of wood rubbing against each other.
And you are?
Mark, it's going through. Your mate's sorted it. We're going cruising!
It's pretty much a clean bill of health. I did think I had ringworm once but it turned out to be a cigarette burn.
(Shit, there's nothing stopping me now! But can I go through with it? Maybe it's better off staying as a nice idea, like the Private Finance Initiative.)
Alan I'm sorry, but he's not a criminal, he's just an idiot.
Not a problem. (Is this humiliating? It is a bit humiliating. I guess the upside is that what I was doing before was humiliating in a way I wasn't even aware of.)
She's... I think she's very pretty.
Ooh, sorry. Not getting much sleep. They found asbestos in my airing cupboard so I'm on a camp bed in the hall.
No, I can't! (He's leaving me with two women. I can't date two women! I can barely date one!)
Well we might take things slow to start with, yeah?
Mate, I know you want to-
I did. Thierry Henry, he made Savage look like a right carthorse didn't he?
Still, good to clear the air.
We'd need 50K, and an extension on the cottage.
Most people just go around nodding to the last opinion they heard, don't they?
Has Sophie been keeping you up? Oh, sorry. She's in Bristol now, isn't she? Probably keeping some other guy up now.
Sorry, I didn't think.

(It's fine, there's nothing to worry about. She's not fucking anyone. We're just sitting watching TV. That's bad body language. She hasn't mentioned that homeless guy once. Probably wants me to forget all about him.) [Nancy stands up and leaves the room] (That's it, she's off! She's leaving me. Fuck!) Where- where are you going?
Well, stand up straight, take your trousers off.
(Oh God, what am I gonna do next, set fire to the tree?)

Have you not sorted this yet?
No.

No, we can't admit this. That's grounds for a mistrial.
How did you afford this Jeremy?
No, sure mate, yeah. Well, I'm on it. Right well let's crack on.
Of testicles?
Uh, oh, uh, OK, so do you want to start?
A pass? He- the bloody- he's been under a lot of stress recently.
So you accepted the acceptance?
Jeez.
Basically I have.

(Sales, Marketing, Marketing, Sales. All I'm doing is scrolling up and down this useless document, inserting words almost at random. I suppose I can always roll Gerrard out for the sympathy vote. He's my dark secret, my Elephant Man.)
Is he OK?
(Fuck, did I?)
Yeah Jez. The maid must be finished by now.
If our feet touch, we fuck, obviously. Come on, dive in, let the festivities begin.
Do I look like the kind of person who eats pizza?

(The start of my new life. "Hi there, I'm Mark Corrigan, MA, MBA". That spells "mamba", which is a kind of sexy snake. You'll be gone by next week. Why do the thickos come to these things? I suppose because the thickos have insisted no one's allowed to say you're a thicko any more. That's actually quite a clever move by the thickos.)
I've got a degree my friend. Oh yeah. I was here in the glory years. Mid 90s. Britpop was kicking off, Four Weddings had just come out. It was mental.
Err, no.
He's bashful. But, I see brother-in-law material there.
The same cab? But you live in Catford and Gerrard lives in Balham. That's miles apart. It's illogical to share, it's crazy.
Lily Allen.
My God, you are! You are fighting me! This is incredible! You're putting your foot behind me and you're pushing me down towards the floor! Finally, you're restraining me!
It always makes me think of skiing holidays. We always used to go skiing on holiday. Me, my mum, my sister.
She said you two have been out.
Um, excuse me, ladies and gents. Oi! Sorry, hi, er, I'm afraid the, er, the best man, er, has gone AWOL. Um, but don't worry. Just eat some cheese and I'll get it sorted. Jez, Jez. Um, would you?

So listen up guys. I'm looking to shake up the department, and I want you two to be my enforcers. Mm? My Cheech and Chong. My Skinner and Baddiel. You'll be the iron fists inside my velvet glove. The spiky balls on the end of my stick. Yeah?
Right, in mine, we sort of try quite hard. (He's trying to strangle my Christmas with Sellotape.)
Uh huh, that's right. (Should I tell him? Really don't want to. Is that because I don't want to see a friend hurt? Or can't be arsed with the massive hassle?)
It's really... honestly, it's nothing.
Somewhere with flowers, coffee and sedatives, medical assistance. Maybe with music, but not too jaunty. Melancholy music.
Golden snitch. Apparently, the yellows like to mix it up a bit, chuck a ball bearing in the paintball pot to make things interesting.

(Well, that was a fucking disaster. I want compensation. I want reparations, brutal reparations! I want the Rhineland. It's going to be 1919 all over again. Fuck the inevitable backlash! OK. It's OK, Mark. Later. Now, calm. Calm, honest and mature.)
Jeremy, you once told me that chairs make you feel horny.
Nothing, what? I don't know, is there a problem?
What? I'm not out of my mind! I just need to give you some documents!
Cool place. [Looking around at Dobby's colleagues] (Wonder who's tried to jump her. He'll have had a pop.)

Often, Mark, you ejaculate quite a long time before I've had time to feel like I've started to enjoy our sex.
This is fun, isn't it?

Table four, Mark. I ought to be going.

[Singing] I am in loco parentis. I am the last remaining contestant on The Apprentice. I am the home-trained dentist. Aya ya ya ya ya ya ya ya ya ya ya ya...

Are you OK?

Look, I think the best thing for you is if we just stick you out on the balcony.

Tell him to turn it up to eleven! That's a Spinal Tap joke.
(And so the descent into hell begins. Just hope they're all Snow Patrol. If it's not Snow Patrol or the Beatles, I am so fucked.)

Bye.

Listen to you, you beautiful crazy thing. I meant... the cancer.
Well, he is a dickhead.

Can't handle it?

I don't know, the... men.

[seeing Jeff whispering to Sophie] (She's not going to smile, Jeff. You can't laugh at someone you don't trust. It's like Mum singing the lumberjack song after she had her affair.)
Oh right.

I'm Jeremy, Mark's oldest and closest friend.
Jeremy, I was in the underpass with these two-

In he goes.
How'd it go? What did he say?
Hello, everybody.
Yeah. Yeah, sure. It's just Dave's been... you know.
Have you thought about giving him a call?
Mark, I've taken a solemn oath. I know that doesn't mean a lot to you but I take it quite seriously.
It's just with the hiding-
I've done some more art boxes.
I dunno, they're always good, eggs, aren't they? Till they hatch.
We should let Stu in.
I just feel terrible. I feel like I've been shot in the stomach.
Sure! As simple as me closing the door. And then putting my hand down your trousers.
Gail, she's coming back. Down the road, we need to get out of here. Go, go, go, pedal to the metal.

Mark, what's that in your pocket?
No, no, because of... distortion. There was probably a buzz. There might be an ancient Saxon coin right here.
No, I don't really fancy it. (That's right dance, dance the night away, but you'll pay me back Jeremy, even if you end up dancing in cages at fetish bars.)
No. I'll give you a twatting at Operation if you like.
A loaf of delicious Vogel linseed bread.

Good old Clarkson.
Look, I'd better...
Uh, no, it's... [Mark pulls a pair of black lace panties out of his pocket and holds them out to Sophie.] ...it's your pants.
So, when's she moving out?
Chocks away!

Sorry, guys. I- I was going to, you know, kick it up the other end and just put one right in their fucking goal hole, but no dice. So, I hear something big might be happening for you guys on the other side of the pond?
I didn't get a chance to tell you the good news. Yeah, there's a vacancy going for a clerical assistant and I've managed to swing you an interview.
The thing?
Well, I think you shouldn't be too hasty. Maybe everything will run its course with Duncan and Alison.
[Nervous laugh] Brilliant. (Oh, fuck. This is getting a bit too real. Just keep kissing. If we're kissing, she can't say scary stuff.)
They said they were gonna chop my penis off and put it into another orifice.

Jez.

Don't go! (God, I only asked her to be a hooker. It's not like I wanted her to work in telesales.)

Yeah, that's right honey, I'm a street-fighting man. God, she's probably getting wet just looking at me.) Hold your horses, honey. I've got coupons for the Pringles.

Not doing it?

Mark, listen.
Oof! Yes!

Good luck with this week's reading. Oh one tip - if you're going to plagiarise, try not to do it from a book I've written, something's bound to ring a bell. Mark, April, hold on a minute will you? Listen, I'm having one of my semi-legendary gatherings tonight for potential contributors to my little folly - Rhombus magazine. I wondered if you two might be able to make it.
I've got some more Corfu property details. I think we'll be able to see them all while we're there.
(He couldn't even think of Romeo. Romeo's easy.)

(Don't blame me, blame Ramses II.)

He's off. Closing time in the last chance saloon, Mark. Time to grab your nuts and splurge!

Death hunt? (Mmm, the death hunt. That sounds relaxing and fun.)

About a million!

To the one that was a film about the end of the world, "The Road"? 'Cause they were hungry enough in that.

Got to think through these plans more! I'll just go for these. Coloured. Least that'll make him look faintly ridiculous. Heh, I win! In the most minor way possible.)

Oh, yeah?
The feeling's mutual.

Yes, he has gone like a bit of a maniac. In fact, I think it's probably time you took your leave, Ian.

God! Well, she did smile at me once, so I just caught her eye. Could you tell her I'm sorry?

Disaster, she's got a boyfriend. She seems a lot happier, comfier in her own skin. She's blossomed.

The cervical sweep.

Crack?! I've got company!
What?

(Ah, this is a paintballing nightmare. Must escape, must not die. Enjoy the relaxing game. Keep girlfriend from ex sex.)
Were you here last week?
I mean, it's going a bit, just not the legs.

Leftovers?

You know how it is when you can't wait a second to get a hit of that neat, sweet rum.
(Oh, the but.)
Great, OK! We'll set it up for the staff party on Thursday.

Nine inches. It's a nine-incher. Thought it might spice things up. Trouble is, I find it quite intimidating, as a man. I mean look at it, it's like a leg of lamb. So I've decided to call it "Kenneth", to take the curse off.
Yeah, she says you stare at her like a sex offender. And, if you keep doing it, she'll call the police.
You drank half a bottle of rum on your way back from the shop?
Oh, OK. Wow.

[Still sobbing] ...and everything's just fucked!
Yeah. (What was the football coaching thing? There was something about his job. He really liked his job or something.) I really think I've said enough, to be honest.
(Ah, yes, a ditch. I should burrow further and further into the earth like the worm that I am.)
Look, what the hell is going on?
You just... you... you're lucky I don't... you're just very, very lucky.
Oh, I don't know. Maybe I should? Although, no. It's a no.

Right.

Mark. How's it going, you lovely rotter?

Apparently, he lived on nothing but dry bread and goat milk. But when I picked him up, there were a lot of Nutella jars in his recycling.
All right, keep your wig on.
Great, I got the job!
Jeremy's baby. (Mmm, the great taste of ashes.)
You've life coached the Queen?
Look Jez you were there, fine, you were part of a creative milieu. You contributed to engendering a vibe, out of which emerged my lyric.
So, this is your secret identity? Sort of like Indiana Jones.
Yeah.
Hey, Mark. [Puts a tray on Jeremy's lap] Oh, there you go, hubby. [Turns to Mark] How'd it go tonight?
Uh-huh, OK, smart. Super smart.
Yeah, well, sure, if that's the way you feel, maybe you should.

Right, OK. [notices the kitchen is in disarray, furniture moved and food spread all over the counter] Jez, why's the chair- and what's all this strawberry? And my yoghurt? Jez, what's happened to my Muller? Oh, no, you haven't, have you? You haven't been sexing it up in here with my yoghurt?
That was actually Mark's foot, he does that sometimes, for laughs.
There we go, one for you and one for Ben.
Oh, shouldn't, stomach acid levels are still playing up. I don't know if you noticed, I've got the...
Yeah whatever. (That's all very possible, totally possible.)
Don't think so, she's not really my type.
Why were you phoning me anyway you big idiot?
Jeff?
Executioner's Bong did a bit of Christo. Now they all live in a fuck-off bungalow in Fort Lauderdale eating cherry pie and banging cheerleaders. I'm in.
All right then, we've got our answer. Let's go!
Earlier tonight, I had sex with a man in my bedroom, and-
Yeah, me and Valerie. We were going to kill her brother but then we thought it might be more fun to go to the Lazerbowl.
No, no murdering, it's a misunderstanding.
Oh, hey, Mark.

Yeah, no it's a great to have some downtime working here, 'cause all that crank totally fucked with my mind. I mean, it was pretty well blown to pieces by the size of the IMAX image every day anyway, so...
All right, bunker cleared. Moving on.
No, I'm Robert Grayson.
Hey Jeremy, have you worked out your...?
Don't thank me. Thank the Microsoft Office Family. PowerPoint, Excel and Word. The three amigos.
Yes, date mix up. But I think April will be able to join me. I'm actually talking tomorrow on transcultural memory in the Ottoman Empire.
(This guy is literally a moron.)
All things pass, you know? We're born, we live, we die. Plus Zahra's getting a 3D TV, so it all makes perfect sense, if you think about it.
Did you try and con Dave Franks?
Shut the fuck up.
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: Mark?

Look, Mark, I get it, if this was happening to me, I'd be doing what you're doing a hundred times over. But you don't want to look back on today thinking when your baby was being born, you were taking out a ninja.
Yeah, that's right. You should have put more black pepper in the lasagne, then it would be rammed.
Right, Mike. And which bottle did you bring? Can you please identify your bottle?
(Oddball alert, do not respond, do not engage. Oh, God, he's broken through my icy force field. Maybe he's having a baby, maybe everyone in here is having babies.)
Well, that's nice. Do you want to come in?
Because it was the only thing I could of that made me sound like a proper person.
Yeah, yep. You did it fine.
Right, did you finish with Michelle?
I ran away from home to see Barney, thanks, dickhead!
But you really pulled it off towards the end. For a first-timer, you really impressed me.
Don't be a dick. Go and get it.
They were probably crafted by the ancient inhabitants of Atlantis, and they're powerful centres of healing.
Another drink?
What's the big deal? So I didn't give him the number for Dr Tang. She's got leukaemia. Sticking a few needles in her face at fifty quid a pop is not going to fix that.
Yes, I saw the skit.
Yeah, fine, knackered. Three-day bender. Then Mark got fired 'cause of me and I couldn't sleep 'cause of the guilt.
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: I always knew you'd do well for yourself, Mark, but this is amazing.
Incredibly shitty ethics.
[Banging on the door of Cally's trailer] Cally? Cally? [There's no answer, so Jeremy opens the door]
(Did she wince? That's not good. Wincing isn't mentioned by the romantic poets.)
Best of five?
(An Indiana Jones reference, mixed with a Ghostbusters reference. I love you, April Danecroft.) I couldn't help noticing that your book's co-written.
I have no idea what he's talking about. [Megan stands up and throws a glass of wine in Jez's face] (There goes a valuable glassful.)
Well, I mean, people say it like it's a bad thing, you know, running away from your problems. But if your problems never catch up with you, what's the hitch?
Light it.

Look, I'm sorry if - in an infantilised world - I've somehow ended up with a non-cool toys, but why exactly is arranging a model of the greatest liberal hero of the twentieth century somehow less cool than pretending on a computer that you're a Russian pimp stealing imaginary cars.
Maybe it's time I did something. Show Dan who the lord of the manor is around here. What do you think?
(Ouch, the ghost at the feast. Better take the mustard off.) I mean, it wasn't that great. Lunch was pretty nothing-y. Baked potato, again. Are you all right?
(Hello.)
(I'm staring into the abyss. I don't like the look of the abyss.)
Oh, really? And what's three times a hundred and thirty-three?
I'm really sorry, Mark.
Do you want to cut the cord?
Sure. (Hey, I know what the weird atmosphere is.)
Yeah? Why?
About what? The time you screwed the next-door neighbour right after I moved in?
Oh, yeah.
A bit of crack.

OK, I'm going to tell you the truth now, but only on the condition, the promise, that you don't freak out, because this really isn't a big deal. In no way the kind of big deal that you're going to pretend it is, so-
What?
You know, don't you? You know exactly what's wrong with it.
She gave it to you?
Hey Mark.
What? Oh for God's sake, Mark, we've both got one, haven't we?
Um, they're ready Mark.
Yeah, there are snakes. There are quite a few snakes in your room. It's hard to keep count. They're very good at hiding, sneaky like that.
OK, sure. (Wow, I've got a date. I'm a real piece of shit. I bet those two things go hand in hand. But if I got into defrauding pension as the pussy would really start rolling in.)
(Oh, for God's sake!) Yeah, well, it wasn't really me as such, it was almost as if something was flowing out of me.
I'm really sorry, dude. Um, you can hit me, if you like. Or.. er... or even fork me?
I'm not doing a shift. This is insane.
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: Yeah, living it large on the mini bar while Big Suze is playing the bloody Peter's Friends drinking game with Hugo and Otto and Rozzle and Nozzle.
Really? (If she gets fired and everything goes wrong, I'll be there to pick up the pieces.)
(There he goes, my other half, my better half, 'er indoors.) Mark, we need to talk, there's something I need to say to you.
Course you do. But, what's the most blowjobs you've ever had in one day? Like in the first happy days of a relationship?
No, I don't.
Hope Nancy gets here soon. This is gonna be perfect. She won't know anyone except me.
You're doing pyramid selling?
Yes, Jeremy, it is indeed a headfuck.
It's a very popular time.
Jeremy!
Soph!
Right, well, this is nice. I can put all of my- Ah! Hans, it's a snake!
And then I thought no-one was going to challenge that guy on his xenophobic rant, but I just had to say it, I couldn't let it go.
He definitely wants to fuck you, Mum.
Hey!
No, except now I bang a load of Valium up me arsehole for the comedown.
Oh, man!
(What am I gonna do now? Cover him in milk and start licking him? I'm not gonna lick him.)
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: Dobby.
Sixty million, that's more than Stalin, isn't it?
Don't you like me?
Thanks, but I don't own a CD player.
You're a bloody good guy. God, you're a great guy. Isn't he a bloody good guy, Soph?
Oh yeah, yeah yeah she loves this one, this is one of her faves. Yep, there she goes, that's Saz, that is Saz all over, that is so her.

(Shit, this could be difficult to row back from. This isn't a misspelt email. This is going feral. I mean, rejecting society and seeking the company of wild creatures, that's not going to look good on my quarterly review. [He sees Jeremy, who is scrabbling to pick up the money he threw out the window] What's Jeremy stealing, hotel napkins?)
Mark, your job is going to the office. My job is having sex. Yeah? That's what I do now. That's what I am. I'm a sexer. OK?
No, I am. I'm bang up for that.
Yeah, and not even the good kind of fuck-monkey.
Jeremy, I come from America. I've seen the problems race brings up. [turns and presents herself doggy-style] Now fuck me and pretend I'm your mom!
Sure. Or what about a dance class? If you think you can face it you can come to my dance class!
For my off-key remarks and crazy insights?
Yeah, and good riddance, you... you fucking Nazi!
What? Yeah, but I thought we were on the same wavelength! You know, the sausage, the Euro, Clarkson.
Patrick tells me she's not getting on all that well in Bristol.
Hello, Mark.
You're screwing Cally? I'm out of the band? They can't just do this to me, can they?

Yes, weird. That's exactly the word I was looking for. It's so weird. Weird like, "come over here and drop your nuts into this deep fat fryer", "Oh, OK, ooh, that's a bit weird, what a weird sensation, how weird!" I'm losing my fucking mind here!
I understand you might be able to back up Jeremy's story about the item found in the pool.
Great, so now they'll think we're a couple of guys with our booze, and our pizzas, and a cat we starve, and an old man we've kidnapped whose dentures we periodically deign to cleanse.
Oh, I can't reach, could you?
No, I mean, if I can just search the old memory banks. (For the moment I replay nightly.) We might've had one cuddle once, but that was about it, as I recall.
We could go up to the old air-raid shelter up on the top road maybe?
Hi, Soph, me again. Really, I'm leaving a lot of messages for you today, I know.
Ha-ha! You wouldn't think there was much voltage going through one of those little suckers, but it packs quite a punch, let me tell you.
Hans, please, this is hard for us. I feel that something's died inside, don't you, Mark?
Fuck this shit, it won't go in.
(Oh, brilliant. Freak show sideshow at the shit show.)
It's your fault!
What?!
Sorry, lads. Locked doors. Little switch just flicks, you know? Ever since Dad locked me in the airing cupboard to monitor the home-brew.
Shit, I just don't know. We could try the number.
Relax, Mark, it's all right. We were just feeling very horny.
[Reading the message from Dobby] "Was hoping this weekend would be a chance to make up after all the weirdness." She means you spying on her. You've fucked it, you idiot.
Great, that's nice.
Relax, there are three of us. If they try anything, just whip out a bootlace and take 'em out from behind, nice and easy.

So, thinking about the book launch. Cash bar, but I might provide nuts. Salted, or dry roasted though? Salted, a classic, everyone loves salt, but expensive in the quantities I want to provide. It's tricky.
results.episode: s8e2 - Business Secrets of the Pharaohs

results.quote: Look, can we talk tomorrow? I'm taking my son to a play centre, The Kid Kave. You could bring your niece. It might be fun.
I see.

Listen, while we're at it, there are systems for a reason in this world. Economic stability, interest rates, growth. It's not all a conspiracy to keep you in little boxes. All right? It's only the miracle of consumer capitalism that means you're not lying in your own shit, dying at forty-three with rotten teeth, and a little pill with a chicken on it is not going to change that. Now come on. Fuck off!
No one screws with the Corrigans, not any more. This isn't gonna be like mum and dad's Dolphin Showers fiasco.
I need a cigarette. Has anyone got a cigarette?
Ow, fuck.
(Bonding with Jeff. I'm almost there, Soph. Clear the runway! I'm coming in to land!)
I wish I could help, but I can't.
Mmm. That is quite refreshing.
So, Mark, would you be prepared to go up there with Sophie if that's the way things panned out?
Oh yeah! Very funny! I suppose you think cancer is this huge enormous practical joke!
Can I change any of those? What score did I get? It wasn't good, was it?

(Ugh, I'm doing something I hate for someone who doesn't like me, in order to drive around somebody who, as yet, doesn't even exist. Great, I was hoping for a David Attenborough-type instructor. He's more of your chain-wanking, ringtone fanatic.) [The instructor gets into the car and immediately lights a cigarette] Um-
Fuck off, Jeremy!
No need to pretend? Well, maybe it's time you stopped pretending not to be in love with Big Suze.
So, I like your barn, Ian.
No, you haven't.
For God's sake, Jeremy, that's disgusting.
Um, Thai, I quite like so...
We... are?
Yeah, let's get Dan. Punish Dan.
You seem a bit... I don't know. I hope everything's still... with us... all right.
(Sell it on eBay?)
No need to rub it in, Nance.
Uh-huh.
What?
I haven't been late-night stock-taking. I lied.
Oi-oi, Marco, ready to go? Molly's gang are staying here, so Team Hans are off to burn down the village.

(OK, so, dance class. Ali-kazoo, ali-kazam, let's find out just how fucked I am. OK, here we go. 'And last night Mark was a bit weird.' Fair comment. 'He didn't really get it.' What's to get? 'But, shit! He came, so that was pretty amazing.' OK! 'Had dinner with Jeff later.' Ooh, naughty. 'Gave him a kiss, but not sure. He can be so pushy.' He kissed her?! I've got to make a move!) [squeezes stress ball vigorously] (Maybe I should try tapping her phone.)
Yep. Oh, we thought we had her number, and you got a bit overexcited, but it turned out to be a not very funny joke.
Thanks, so listen, can I get you a drink?
Thanks, Columbo.
Are you kidding, I kicked off! I really want to hurt those bastards! I think the cartoon rocked them. Let me have a think about another savage pun.

(Jeremy's getting a manager, I'm getting divorced. Maybe he'll end up happy and successful, and I won't. That would be typical. I do everything society demands and die in a ditch. He sits on his arse and accidentally shits a golden egg.)
It's a hundred pounds a shift with tips. You could try a shift and see.
Clearly you haven't gone.
Great to see you.
He's gone nuts!
I can't, really, it's not-
The whole work gang? I don't think so. Do you mind if I get changed?
Hey, guess what?
(Interview advice from the disordered mind of the crackhead.) Right.
All right, I'll bloody do it.
Oh, right. Political correctness gone mad.
Oh dear! Poor Rod!
[Zahra's phone rings] Hello? Oh. Hi, Ben.
Hmm, have these sprouts been done properly?
It's lucky you had those boots.

(Fuck you, Poirot!) Look, I'm the bracelet bastard. Dobby's my girlfriend, all right? I'm sorry I didn't mention it before, but we're an item and she's great, and it's going really well, and she may appear to you norms like a bit of a freak, but I don't care.
God, you're great.
Your sheath?
No.
But I really like you and we have a great time together.

I'll take it. And you know what? This means nothing to me. I haven't got a penny in the world, Suze, but this means nothing to me without you. [Jeremy throws the cash out of the window] There, you see? Now do you see? That's how I feel. Now will you go back out with me?
Mark, come on, what the hell's going on?
Mark, can you give me a hand microwaving these chicken bites?
Great, that's great.
I'm having a party.
But then we totally did. I mean, if it makes you feel any better, the sex was terrible. We didn't connect. She's LEGO, I'm a Stickle Brick. Plus she's very orally focused, whereas I'm-
All right, mate. So, you're mates with Wankathon?
Thanks, Jez.

Well, um I felt a lot of stuff to do with rejection coming up for me tonight. Um, I was dancing with someone and they made it very clear that they didn't want to be with me. Uh and it just brought up a lot of feelings. That's all. Thanks.
Jeremy!
Right!
Super Hans?
Mark?
What, Jeremy? Were you?
Just take it off. We'll talk about why after you've taken it off.
I owe Jez. He took a bullet for me. You, you're a pure chrome dildo. Solid.
Oh for fuck's sake. I'm off to get a drink.

(Eating from a bucket like a human horse. I feel refreshed and replenished and now back to the hospital. No need to run, and still got some beans and a sweetcorn for Sophie. Probably just what she fancies.)
Exactly. So you should all have had time to look at the task.
As a penance, I went to live with the monks on Mount Athos for three months.
When do we get to go out?
Hey, Suze.
If you had to. If the men came and they made us, with their guns.
Definitely. You gotta follow your dream. (Case closed, next.)

(Now we're back to mate! This is a nightmare.) No problem, mate, pal. So, I bet I can see my mates from up here, yeah? Oh, yeah, look, there they are, laughing away like a pair of bloody idiots at absolutely nothing.
What's this? Mummy?
Yes, those are my words.
What?
No, challenging is right, um, but a bit more of a relaxing challenge. More like doing a crossword than a tracheotomy.
It'll be fine, just follow my lead.
(Ugh. Day one and the housemate gets dicked over.)
What are you smiling for? Look, scouting is a noble tradition. You do not have to be a paedo to want to work with children, all right?
(Bet he's naked.)
Er, yeah. We've got a no smackheads, no crackheads rule, so, the, er, the old long list is pretty short.
Have you been doing your breathing exercises? And taking Rescue Remedy? You might be low on zinc. Sorry.
Maybe we should have Salad Niçoise, why the fuck not? I mean, who even cares?
All right.

Really? Festivus? I'm playing the Wolverhampton Festivus? Oh my God Mark, I'm in the money. Everything's going to be all right, I am gonna be a legend. And you, and all of this depressing shit, will just be a little footnote in the massive biog of how rich and fucked up I eventually became.
No, no, no Jez, when you're finished just drop your Rizla in the bowl.
How could she do something like that to me? God. I love her. I really love her [breaks down crying]. What am I gonna do?
Yeah. But he's been made redundant, sadly. And I'm thinking maybe you could have a little chat with him.
Jeremy, the Yardies aren't gonna solve all your problems. Why do you always think that the Yardies are the answer to everything?
We're not playing for points, mate.
I know, I know I am. You must hate me.
Theatre? (Theatre, nothing good has ever happened in a theatre. Oh, fuck!) Sophie, are you OK?
This is the whole point about contract law, the whole point of a contract is to make sure this kind of thing never happens!
(Oh, great. I'm going out with literally the worst men in the world.)
Oh no, God, I'm over the moon.
(And he's really good at this, unlike any game actually involving a bat.)
Almost did mate. Almost fucking did. I kicked off big time. But then I thought, maybe I can work from the inside. No point in both of us getting kicked out of the band.
We've got to get out of here!
I don't know you see them around.
But watch out though, I'm on your tail. I'm Hawksmoor, you're Wren. (Oh my God, I've fallen in love with her. But of course, brilliant, how incredibly predictable. What a total fucking dope.)
Oh, that's nice. Thanks, man.
I've been thinking about us. You know I'm looking for a lodger, and you and me do go really good together. Well, I was thinking, how about you move in?
So, what now? Back to the flat?
(She'll get bored of him. Just like she got bored of me.)
Ha-ha. Brilliant.
Er, hi, Zahra, Jez here. Yeah, erm, we're locked in your building, so if you could come back and release us from the cage, that'd be much appreciated, thanks a lot, bye-bye.
Super Hans could show me the rest of the equipment.
Hi Jez.
Mark, are you actually Sherlock Holmes?
Your Holsten Pils keyring? The guys over at Holsten are laughing their arses off at you, advertising their beer to yourself every time you come home.
(Look at that. The Devil and Eve and a serpent. And if there was an apple this would be a whole famous... thing.)
I um...
Dobby's got a boyfriend.
What?
This piece of paper says that I am fucked.

Yeah it is cool. (More like a honey trap for social retards. When the Normalo-Nazis firebomb these places, the geek race will be wiped out forever.) So, what was the amazing Dobby news that you had to tell me in person?
Oh. Brilliant.
It's an ironical day out.
And what does Gregory do?
Oh, Robin Williams? That sap? She likes him? That is so sappy.
To toast my promotion. Say hello to the new travelling sales rep for Baths, Bathrooms & Fittings.
Arses! I need to do a CV for this shit job Sophie wants me to apply for. Anonymous desk flesh. Faceless office droid.
Shall we shake on it Mark?
But are you sure this isn't ...racist?
Really glad to be moving in with you, Hans. (Literally nowhere else to go.)
Yeah, truth to power, my friend. (I need to get away and count my beans. I think he's trying to take some of my bloody beans.)
[Noticing the wound on Mark's forehead]  What happened with your...?
That's bullshit, I've got seventy-three. Right. Shit, I need to sort this. I mean, what am I gonna do? What's gonna happen here? 'Cause personally, I have no idea.
He fell out of his basket. I rescued him.
That's right Stu, God didn't protect you from my big fist. Yeah, you big lump of monk.
And what about now that it's been confined to the bag for a couple of hours?
OK, Jez, mate. I think that's about it.
Look, dickhead or not, he belongs here in the real world.
Uh, you might want to give that a bit of a rinse, actually, mate.
Jez, mate, can you stop jamming?
Oh come on, mate. How am I going to see Nancy again if you don't give me a pass? She clearly hates me.
Ah nice, thanks man. Yeah, take five if you want. Swim a few lengths.
Where are those clothes I asked for?
(This is it. All systems are go. The apple is ripe, the cross hairs are centralised.) Soph, I was wondering, do you like Indonesian food?
What difference does it make?
You're moving in with Michelle?
Who knows how these things happen? There are powers at work beyond our understanding.
Well, Holmes is certainly the guv'nor. But, I don't think I really want a costume.
Phony Tony, I call him. This government's all spin. It's all smoke and mirrors.
You haven't done anything, have you Soph?
Well, yeah.
OK, well I'll go and talk to her for you.
Dad? Jez has offered to do the shopping run and no one else is fit to drive.
I'm not even sure Dobby still likes me. She wants me to be different. And I want her to be different. Maybe it's just not right.
This really has to be good now. I'm about to live the dream, but I'm scared it'll be that dream where I'm naked on a toilet outside Carpetright.
Yes, you can.
Sorry, Mark. You're contaminated. You're the astronaut with typhoid and I'm gonna stand well back while you're fired out of the airlock.
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: Oh yeah, I know. They're great aren't they? (Here we go. My God, I'm gonna have to learn to ride a horse.)
Jez, I need to...
That's right, Mark. Thirty years.
Hello!

That was my hunch, 'cause, you know, well, I'm bound by strict confidentiality, but I think it's OK to tell you because you know him a bit. Neil likes to get handcuffed and then pulled off with gloves on.
[In a high-pitched voice] Can I have my Blackberry back, please?
No worries. I'll hang out with Jez, watch Animal Planet and get all drugged up on reefers.
The Home Secretary, Jeremy. You're the Home Secretary.
Mark?
You joke Jeremy, but word travels, word travels. No one's dancing. Let's try some other music. You've had your chance. I'm putting this on, Jeremy.
(Out of bread and crackers. Just need to state it with conviction.)
(You're not a paedo. You're definitely not a paedo.)
So am I. I mean, not actually but it's like I am. Only negative is no Dobby. If it peaks before Dobby gets here, I've wasted good party.

Mr. Usbourne has been in contact to say that he believes that the granting of this loan to him was "out of proportion with the just working of the universe". He does not wish to be responsible for "another Greece". And he's claiming mental incapacity due to the influence of the internet reducing his attention span, against his own will.
results.episode: s9e6 - Are We Going To Be Alright?

results.quote: (And the fun part is, everything I do is basically wrong. If I can just get hold of a hand, that might feel useful.)
Hi.
The wine, Soph.
Hi there.
So, you all look pretty happy. Being students. Well, I've got news for you
Isn't this beautiful?
(Oh, Angus, you just can't seem to say the right thing. You lovely arsehole.)
An incorrect Sherlock Holmes pipe.
What lies?
I think we should just choose somewhere now, anywhere, I'm tired.
Oh right, they enjoy it do they, the tiny men? Like the elephant enjoys doing the ballet moves? It's exploitation, Mark. What are you doing?
Ten weeks.
Ben's gonna be here any minute. I've got to hide.
They're all my mugs, Jez. Jerry's a William Morris fan, we both are. "Have nothing in your room that you do not believe to be beautiful or know to be useful."
I thought it would give him a bit of edge. We're thinking of going short with the hair soon, too.
Jez, I need to get to work.
(Oh Sophie, not again. I'm not having a baby, I'm having a party.)
Thanks, Jez.
Yeah, so I've been hanging out here quite a bit since I got made redundant. It's cool.
Can you tell him I need to talk to him?
Chemical castration, classic!
Some guy. He's taken some guy into my room. Oh, God. Is he going to sell all my stuff, or, or download something horrible onto my computer?
Look mate, were not gonna be any trouble.
Standby?

(OK, Freehold Committee, prepare to meet your new leader.) I honestly think I've nailed this. I've got this great riff about bees and their role within the hive that I think's really gonna speak to people. Everybody loves bees.
You can't find your niche between 9 and 11
Sure, sure. Maybe later.
Yeah. We thought we might smash your brains in with a baseball bat.
Yeah I'm fine. (Probably missed the moment to smack him now.) How are you?
I got him, he's bagged.
You know where I am tonight.
Brilliant, well done, mate.
(Of course. He's a pathetic worm, just like me, good.)
Is it? It is? Oh, right. Fantastic. And you haven't told anyone about it?
Wouldn't you like to know, you big prick! So what are you doing?
Because it's an emergency! And in an emergency, you watch breaking news, and count your tins of butter beans. You don't sit in the garden and put on Kiss FM.
Fuck buddy?
Well, somebody tried to get me sectioned, and nobody gets Super Hans sectioned.

(Perfect. The kind of scenario that used to terrify me, but now I can totally handle. Just lean in, or pull her towards me and just simply- this is my chance! And I'm doing nothing, I am now, this instant, missing my chance.)
Jez, you're not a talentless, misguided dickhead. That's the last thing you are.
No, she did. With Super Hans. So, that's nice. I think I might divorce her, see how she likes that.
I'm coming in if you're decent. I'm going for coffee. [Notices the papers on the mirror] What happened?
(Seemed to get away from the Cally thing.)
How about Pictionary after lunch?
They will now recite the vows they have written together.
Uh-huh. That's- that's a good story. Um, anything I could use that might be a bit more romantic? Also, and I know this might sound like a bit of a starter question, but... what's your name?
I know my rights. I've spoken to my friends at the Citizens Advice Bureau. Pay up, or I shall make a disturbance.
